titleStmt.title: Letter from Tom Bass to Thomas Hardy (H.858)

supportDesc.support: Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, on ruled paper, headed “22 Delta Street, Lightbowne, Moston, Manchester.”

origin.origPlace: 22 Delta Street, Lightbowne, Moston, Manchester, England

div.p:
First of all I ask you to excuse me
for the liberty I take in writing to you.
Today is beautiful, although the atmo-
sphere is anything but pleasant.
Illumination pours down its warm pure
rays, speaking to everything in this
beautiful old world. I am just an
ordinary young working man, though
not one of the most fortunate in life,
yet I possess riches untold, and beyond
price,—it is not the ordinary wealth,
or jewels: it is something far, far
more precious; it is the love of all
that is beautiful in the world of
literature and the Classsic arts.
Often after a long day in the work-
shop, the head splitting, riveting,
the hammering, the thuds of the cranks,
the whirr and hum, and rattle of
various types of machinery, relieved
by the snatch of a whistling, humming,
or singing of a popular air; by snatches
we manage to catch
those whiffs of the outside world per-

colating defiantly the noise. How they per-
spire, the path of the perspiration, making
perpendicular lines down the face and neck
almost resembling the tattoo designs one is
familiar with in the illustrations of the
few surviving Maoris. It is the blood
message of toil, away home, tea, to
tired to leave the cottage, so after read-
ing a portion of the newspaper to my angel
mother, who is not able to read, away to
the solitude of my bedroom to indulge
in one of the treats of my life—the book.
My affected imagination soon transports
me to the land of romance, the scenes,
or the flowery dells. I borrow books now,
—times have been so bad, I have
been obliged to sell much of my book
collection. Your books have brought to me un-
told delight; now I am wanting to borrow
the latest publication of some of your
poems &c. &c. You see I enclose a stamped
addressed envelope. I wish to know if
you will kindly favour me by sending me
your autograph. It will be a great treasure
from an author who to me has been a
source of encouragement, helping to take off
a share of the roughnesses of life. My kindest
thoughts and good wishes to you. God Bless You.
I Remain,
Yours Sincerely,
Tom Bass. 8/6/22.
